name: SQAT Lab
tagline: Software Quality and Testing Lab material
body:
## Announcements
### Master student thesis available
Me and Burak are looking for a master student who would like to work and write his/her thesis on the topic of **Data Visualization**.  
The aim of the thesis work should be the development of a prototype application (we can decide which kind of) that presents meaningful visualization of unit-test execution results and low-level events logged by Eclipse.  
The initial requirements for you will be:
* Start ASAP (by the end of September)
* Produce a report of your work by the end of October
* Try to submit the result of your work to a software engineering conference
    * If your results will be published the department will pay your a grant of 2000Euros

I have already a small prototype (written using D3.js that could be a good starting point for you).  
If you are interested please contact me.

### The slides of the first session are available: 
* [Intro to SQAT Lab](http://unioulu-tol.github.io/SQATLab/sessions/session1.html)
* [Introduction to unit-testing and JUnit](http://unioulu-tol.github.io/SQATLab/sessions/session1a.html)
   - [ShoppingCart source code](https://github.com/UniOULU-TOL/ShoppingCart)
   - [Wii Tennis exercise](http://unioulu-tol.github.io/SQATLab/sessions/WiiTennis.txt)

### The slides of the second session are available: 
* [Test-driven Development: a gentle introduction](http://unioulu-tol.github.io/SQATLab/sessions/session2.html)
* [Refactoring with examples](http://unioulu-tol.github.io/SQATLab/sessions/session2a.html)
* [Source code for the Wii Tennis exercise](https://github.com/UniOULU-TOL/WiiTennis)
